ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with occipital encephalocele/meningocele, postaxial polydactyly, and cystic renal disease. The lumbosacral meningocele and Chiari II malformation align with the neural tube defects seen in Meckel syndrome.
Features postaxial polydactyly, CNS malformations including hydrocephalus, and clubfoot. The neural tube defects and polydactyly pattern match well with this patient.
Can present with polydactyly and CNS malformations, though typically features the characteristic molar tooth sign. The Chiari II malformation could represent a CNS anomaly variant.
Features microcephaly, postaxial polydactyly, and clubfoot. While neural tube defects are less common, they can occur in severe cases.
Classically presents with postaxial polydactyly and can have CNS anomalies, though neural tube defects are not typical features.
Features postaxial polydactyly and CNS malformations, typically hypothalamic hamartoma. The neural tube defects seen here are atypical but possible.
Common features include microcephaly, postaxial polydactyly, and neural tube defects. Clubfoot can also occur. Chromosomal analysis would confirm.
